Text: FW FW TOP GAS CPS AS OF Cc John Attached is the Daily Counterparty Report If you have any questions call me Jennifer Original Message From Sweitzer Tara Sent Friday November PM To Denny Jennifer Puthigai Savita Moorer Torrey Johnson Adam George Fraisy Subject FW TOP GAS CPS AS OF Jennifer The Arnold report has been reviewed and looks good Thanks Tara

EOL Issues Cc immediate response on an EOL issue such as a next day deal that is not showing up in Sitara either call me at or Torrey Moorer at If you are unable to reach either one of us please page us at the following numbers Please pass this information to others in your group Thank you Jennifer de Boisblanc Denny Torrey Moorer

EOL Issues Cc immediate response on an EOL issue such as a next day deal that is not showing up in Sitara either call me at or Torrey Moorer at If you are unable to reach either one of us please page us at the following numbers Please pass this information to others in your group Thank you Jennifer de Boisblanc Denny Torrey Moorer

EOL Issues Cc immediate response on an EOL issue such as a next day deal that is not showing up in Sitara either call me at or Torrey Moorer at If you are unable to reach either one of us please page us at the following numbers Please pass this information to others in your group Thank you Jennifer de Boisblanc Denny Torrey Moorer

transaction cancellation q q nymex heat cracks with hess energy trading co on eol on March and Cc The customer changed their mind again wants an termination letter produced for the deals attached Tana Please let me know if you need any other information in order to create the documentation neccessary Thank you for your help Jennifer Forwarded by Jennifer deBoisblanc DennyHOUECT on PM Larry NRON PM To Jennifer deBoisblanc CT cc Subject transaction cancellation q q nymex heat cracks with hess energy trading co on eol on March and Hetco and Enron have mutually agreed to cancel these transactions and not net them out via eol Sorry for any confusion Please send them the apropriate paperwork Thank You

Re transaction cancellation q q nymex heat cracks with hess energy trading co on eol on March and got your email this morning call me on Monday Have a good weekend From Tana Jones on PM To Jennifer deBoisblanc CT cc Subject Re transaction cancellation q q nymex heat cracks with hess energy trading co on eol on March and Jennifer If youre still there give me a call in calgary about this Im at Jennifer deBoisblanc Denny PM To Tana CT cc Mark CT Mary Griff CT Sheri CT Torrey CT Larry Joe CT Shifali SharmaNAEnron Kim S CT Larry nron Subject transaction cancellation q q nymex heat cracks with hess energy trading co on eol on March and Mark The customer changed their mind again wants an termination letter produced for the deals attached Tana Please let me know if you need any other information in order to create the documentation neccessary Thank you for your help Jennifer Forwarded by Jennifer deBoisblanc DennyHOUECT on PM Larry NRON PM To Jennifer deBoisblanc CT cc Subject transaction cancellation q q nymex heat cracks with hess energy trading co on eol on March and Hetco and Enron have mutually agreed to cancel these transactions and not net them out via eol Sorry for any confusion Please send them the apropriate paperwork Thank You

Termination on EOL deal Cc Sheri has asked me to send you the following information in order to prepare a termination agreement for the following EOL deal On Monday April th the day the transaction occurred Enron had network issues that caused some external connection issues During this time the customer accidently hit the same product twice I verified that there was exact transactions by the noted counterparty We were not aware that our trader let them out of the second transaction until late afternoon or else we would of mandated an OTC transaction to net out the second EOL transaction Please call me with any questions Thanks Jennifer EOL Sitara Seller ENA Buyer US Gas Volume Price Delivery Pt PGE Ctygte Period of Del Frank Ermis is the Enron trader Please call me if you need any additional information Sheri

FW FYI this is something you may want to get your arms around Cc Due to the recent organizational changes with Sheri Thomas Amita Gosalia see memo below we will need to remove them as agents and attorneysinfact to execute Password Applications on behalf of EOL and ad d Savita Puthigai Lara McKinney and myself Also Dale Neuner should be removed as he is no longer part of EnronOnline operations but is responsible for DealBench and CommodityLogic operations Savita suggested we also add Torrey Moorer since I will be out on maternity leave in mid July and he will be backing me up during that time Can you let me know the turnaround time of a change like this Also is it separate documentation for North America and Europe Thank you for your help Jennifer To better leverage intellectual capital across Enron Net Works we have several organizational announcements to share with you Sally Beck Tom Gros and Beth Perlman will work together to direct our efforts to commercialize our mid and back office services They wi ll report to the ENW Office of the Chair Sally will continue to lead the daytoday operations of our mid back office In addition to leading the development and marketing of Commodity Logic Tom will have primary responsibility for the marketing of our mid back office services Beth will continue to lead IT development for the Americas including Commodity Logic and all other systems necessary to deliver mid back office services Joining Toms marketing team are Sheri Thomas Frank Davis Andrea Crump Jeff Harbert and Fred Philipson The EnronOnline Product Control function currently reporting to Sheri Thomas will fold into EnronOnline Operations Savita Puthigai will lead t he combined group which will have responsibility for all nonIT daytoday operations Sheri will move to the mid back office commercialization effort reporting to Tom Gros Jennifer Denny will assume Sheris responsibilities as the lead for product control Amita Gosalia director of EnronOnline Europe Support has accepted a new position with EBS in London With her departure Lara Fields will assume responsibility for the EnronOnline support team in Europe and report to Savita Paul Goddard will continue to lead our marketing efforts in Europe and report directly to Andy Zipper who will continue to lead all of EnronOnlines activities Angela Connelly will continue to manage EnronOnlines content in Europe and report to Kal Shah Additionally J ohn Pavetto John Cummings John Allario Mike Haney and Jake Staffel will join Andys team to focus on origination opportunities around the EnronOnline application Rex Shelby and David Berberian will focus on special initiatives and new business opportunities Brandon Wax will manage ENWs investment portfo lio Mark S Palmer will lead the Transaction Development and Structuring team In their new roles Rex Brandon and Mark will report to the ENW Office of the Chair Please join us in congratulating everyone on their new responsibilities and thank you for your continued support as we position ENW for the future Original Message From Puthigai Savita Sent Tuesday May AM To Denny Jennifer Subject RE FYI this is something you may want to get your arms around Will do Original Message From Denny Jennifer Sent Monday May PM To Puthigai Savita Cc Lees Lisa Subject FW FYI this is something you may want to get your arms around Importance High Savita I think Lara myself you need to be added to this and others removed This is for PAs which are in Lisas group Do you want to speak with Sheri Legal Mark Taylor Tana Jones Original Message From Neuner Dale Sent Monday May PM To Denny Jennifer Subject FYI this is something you may want to get your arms around Importance High The Unanimous Written Consent of Managers of EnronOnline LLC dated effective as of appoints Amita Gosalia Dale Neuner and Sheri Thomas as agents and attorneysinfact to execute Password Applications on behalf of EOL This resolution will expire one year from the date of its effectiveness When executing these signatories must sign as Agent an d Attorneyinfact Dale Neuner Manager Product Control Groups CommodityLogic DealBench

Termination on EOL deal Cc Sheri has asked me to send you the following information in order to prepare a termination agreement for the following EOL deal On Monday April th the day the transaction occurred Enron had network issues that caused some external connection issues During this time the customer accidently hit the same product twice I verified that there was exact transactions by the noted counterparty We were not aware that our trader let them out of the second transaction until late afternoon or else we would of mandated an OTC transaction to net out the second EOL transaction Please call me with any questions Thanks Jennifer EOL Sitara Seller ENA Buyer US Gas Volume Price Delivery Pt PGE Ctygte Period of Del Frank Ermis is the Enron trader Please call me if you need any additional information Sheri

Proposed Retention Bonuses for Netcopst Louise I am sorry to bother you at such a critical time because I know you are doing everything you can to salvage the remaining pieces at Enron and are working long tiresome hours to achieve this difficult matter However I felt like I had to at least let you know my thoughts on the following Dave Forster I met a couple of weeks ago on his initiative to discuss the proposed retention bonuses for my group I was asked to review the preliminary numbers by individual I was allowed to move dollars but NOT allowed to increase the total dollar figure for my group Frankly the numbers seemed pretty low Assuming the goal is to retain key employees for Netco I am not confident these numbers will achieve this I know several people in my group are interviewing outside of the company I have asked them to be patient not make any quick decisions and give us a chance to see this through Dave told me the figures were based on mid year evaluations As you know mid year evaluations are typically lower than year end The mid year evaluation allows the employee time to improve in order to get to the desired level by year end I understand the need for a reference point of some sort and mid year was the latest figure available However because the retention numbers were based on this they are significantly lower My intentions are not to show any disrepect to Dave by discussing this with you but I wanted to make sure my thoughts opinions were communicated to you If Dave has already discussed this with you I apologize for the duplication If you have any questions please feel free to call me I am on holiday will be traveling today but can be reached on my cell at Thank you for your time Jennifer

Proposed Retention Bonuses for NetcoLouise I am sorry to bother you at such a critical time because I know you are doing everything you can to salvage the remaining pieces at Enron and are working long tiresome hours to achieve this difficult matter However I felt like I had to at least let you know my thoughts on the following Dave Forster I met a couple of weeks ago on his initiative to discuss the proposed retention bonuses for my group I was asked to review the preliminary numbers by individual I was allowed to move dollars but NOT allowed to increase the total dollar figure for my group Frankly the numbers seemed pretty low Assuming the goal is to retain key employees for Netco I am not confident these numbers will achieve this I know several people in my group are interviewing outside of the company I have asked them to be patient not make any quick decisions and give us a chance to see this through Dave told me the figures were based on mid year evaluations As you know mid year evaluations are typically lower than year end The mid year evaluation allows the employee time to improve in order to get to the desired level by year end I understand the need for a reference point of some sort and mid year was the latest figure available However because the retention numbers were based on this they are significantly lower My intentions are not to show any disrepect to Dave by discussing this with you but I wanted to make sure my thoughts opinions were communicated to you If Dave has already discussed this with you I apologize for the duplication If you have any questions please feel free to call me I am on holiday will be traveling today but can be reached on my cell at Thank you for your time Jennifer

FW Third Party Trading Platform PolicyWe are going a few months back but I need your help on a question Did the draft email below go out to the traders Was it sent to NA traders only Was another sent to European traders If it was sent can you send Savita I the final memo Savita has suggested that the point of contacts change to the designated people below Thank you for your help on this Please call me if you have any questions Thanks Jennifer Original Message From Puthigai Savita Sent Tuesday May PM To Denny Jennifer Subject RE Third Party Trading Platform Policy Please follow up with Leslie or Mark Also we should get it changed to have you as the lead Torrey and myself as the back up in that orderAlso if one was executed for Europe we should make Lara the lead for those Thanks Savita Original Message From Denny Jennifer Sent Tuesday May PM To Puthigai Savita Subject RE Third Party Trading Platform Policy Sheri told me that it was sent out to the traders Actually as I recall I think I was put on it as a backup to Sheri for a point of contact Im not sure if European traders were sent anything I can check with Leslie or Mark to confirm Let me know if you want me to follow up on this or if would rather do it yourself Original Message From Puthigai Savita Sent Tuesday May PM To Thomas Sheri Cc Denny Jennifer Subject FW Third Party Trading Platform Policy Hi Sheri Did we ever send this email out to the traders Savita Original Message From Gosalia Amita Sent Tuesday May AM To Puthigai Savita McKinney Lara Subject Third Party Trading Platform Policy Hi Guys Please see below the last email I had from Sheri re rd Party Trading Platform Policy Dont think the document was ever sent out Certainly was not sent to the European offices Rgds Amita Forwarded by Amita GosaliaLONECT on Sheri Thomas To Amita CT cc Subject Third Party Trading Platform Policy here it is I have asked that one other person here be added Jennifer in case I am out Lets talk about how we can manage this Sheri Forwarded by Sheri ThomasHOUECT on PM OLE Object Picture Device Independent Bitmap Leslie Hansen PM To Andy nron Sheri CT cc Mark CT Subject Third Party Trading Platform Policy Andy and Sheri Here is a draft of what I propose Mark Frevert and Mark Haedicke send out to the traders re use of thirdparty electronic trading platforms Note that I included a contact for questions at the bottom of the policy I have listed myself for now who would you like to designate Will this email go out to European and other business units as well and if so from the same senders Mark Taylor has approved the email and the policy Let me know what you think I will circulate to Mark Haedicke for approval as soon as I receive your comments andor approval Leslie Many of you have received offers to use third party electronic trading platforms like Dynegydirect Enron has a Policy Relating to Use of Third Party Electronic Trading Platforms to serve as a guide to appropriate registration for and use of such trading platforms The Policy provides that You must notify the Enron Net Works LLC ENW designee set out in the Policy if you would like to trade on such a trading platform All registration and other documentation must be sent to the ENW designee who will coordinate the necessary legal and administrative review You are not authorized to use a thirdparty electronic trading platform until you are authorized by ENW The Master User for all thirdparty electronic trading platform accounts will be an ENW designee If you are currently using any thirdparty electronic trading platform please notify the ENW designee A full copy of the Policy Statement is attached for your review File POLICY RE USE OF THIRD PARTY ELECTRONIC TRADING PLATFORMSdoc
